intro: Pterophorus asper, commonly known as the asper moth, is a species of gelechioid moth belonging to the family Pterophoridae. It is characterized by its small size and distinctive wing patterns, which often feature intricate, feathery textures. The larvae of this species typically feed on various plants, including grasses and sedges, contributing to the ecological dynamics of its habitat. Its life cycle involves complete metamorphosis, with the adult stage being primarily active at night. The plant associations of Pterophorus asper are important for understanding its role in local ecosystems and its interactions with other organisms.
